column4: Anyone know the Xsession scripts well enough to tell me why FVWM can't start from gdm?!?
does it have an entry in /usr/share/xsessions?
Yes
By the way, this was working until I did an apt-get dist upgrade from Breezy to Dapper this morning :-)
try to find if the .desktop entry point to the write executable. that is all i can think of
the executable might have been erased and you need to install the dapper package
i had a similar problem Nothus
what is the problem can not you start gnome
Starting gnome or fvwm comes up with the same error..
did you look at gdm.conf
what is the error by the way
.xsession-errors: stty: standard input: Inappropriate ioctl for device
From the upgrade? It wasn't one of the things I was asked to keep, so I assume it installed a new one?
it is a serial dev not sure what is it. but you can install kdm or xdm though i doubt gdm is the problem
I kept the old version of gdm.conf cos I have it setup to allow remote XDMP
you can just change that later. keep your old file under another name for ref
Yeah, I think there's something being called, but I can't tell what, cos I can start X manually and it works..
i am not sure if they changed anything in it though
Cool, I'll have to give that a bash later.. Need to go now.. Work is having a social
Thanks :-)
enabling xdmp is not that hard :) srore it as gdm.conf-old and reinstall the new one
